title: Tesco replaces 'irritating' unexpected item in the bagging area self-checkout voice with male recording
text:
28.715 +0.045 
The supermarket has responded to customer complaints that the voice at self-checkouts is "shouty" and frustrating 
More than a decade after self-service checkouts swept through UK supermarkets, your items in the bagging area are no longer unexpected . 
Tesco (Xetra: 852647 - news ) has announced it will replace the audio voice that talks customers through its self-service and scan-as-you-shop checkouts. 
The grocery giant has described the new voice as "friendlier, more helpful and less talkative" and said the change came about following complaints from customers that the previous instructor's voice was "shouty" and "irritating" . 
Twitter (Xetra: A1W6XZ - news ) users were quick to notice the most obvious difference between the two voices: the annoying voice is female and the friendlier new voice is male. 
Other jokes referred to Tesco's announcement earlier this week that it would no longer sell children's sugary drinks such as Ribena in an attempt to stem rates of obesity in young people . 
Tesco said the new recording would use "softer" phrases such as "this can now be placed in your bag", "all of your Tesco points add up" and "please don't forget your change, especially notes". 
The new instructor also seem to more polite, ending his tips with "Thank you for shopping at Tesco". 
A Tesco spokesperson said: "The gender of the voice happens to be male, but was not our main consideration. We've listened to customer feedback and opted for a friendlier, softer voice who most importantly is programmed to say fewer phrases." 
Last year, the female voice was revealed to belong to Helena Breck , an actress who appeared as Elizabeth Wilmott-Brown on Eastenders in 1994. 
Helena Breck, the face behind the self-checkout voice 
Her replacement can already be heard at Tesco branches in Hatfield, Peterborough, Edinburgh and Kensington. The supermarket said her replacement would be rolled out to all UK stores by the end of October.
